title: Procedural Scaffolding-Based Job Training Course for Improving Online English Writing Proficiency

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level domain knowledge and practical experience, understanding of workplace communication protocols, foundational business English vocabulary and grammar
context.additional_context: Practical writing education for working professionals in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Customized instructional design reflecting learners' work environments (organizational culture, work procedures, document management systems) simultaneously strengthens language skills and problem-solving capabilities required for actual workplace tasks

learning_goals: Learners apply procedural scaffolding strategies to systematically complete complex workplace English writing tasks and strengthen professional communication competencies required of working professionals

During a 4-week intermediate course, learners independently plan (topic selection, outlining, draft completion) and monitor (grammar review, feedback incorporation) English writing processes using interactive checklists twice weekly, cultivating efficient workplace process management skills

Learners revise job reports or business email writing projects incorporating ≥3 peer feedback points and achieve "excellent" ratings in ≥3 of 4 rubric criteria (structure, clarity, professionalism, feedback incorporation), enhancing effective documentation and collaboration skills within organizations

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
